newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela sets 80 bln bolivar TEM bill auction Wed.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela sets 80 bln bolivar TEM bill auction Wed.

text.p: The Central Bank of Venezuela announced for Wednesday morning a 60 billion bolivar ($127 million) auction of 180-day "monetary stabilization," or TEM, bills with a 16.48 percent coupon.
The bank said it would also offer 10 billion bolivars ($21 million) in 269-day bills with a 16.81 percent coupon, and another 10 billion bolivars of 358-day bills with a 17.15 percent coupon.
Yields on benchmark six-month TEMs are widely expected to rise at the auction, following last week's 112 basis points increase on 180-day bills to 16.48 percent.
Thirty-six billion bolivars of TEMs are due to mature on Thursday.
